title: China Merchants Group donates to Djibouti Child Protection Center and DARYEL orphanage
description: On March 21, 2013, the China Merchants Group held a ceremony for a donation to help support the Djibouti Child Protection Center and the orphanage of DARYEL in Djibouti. The donation is worth $200,000 USD and according to the China Merchants Group, this donation was made through China Merchants Charitable Foundation. China Merchants Group says that this donation was for the reconstruction and expansion of existing premises of the child protection center and the orphanage, as well as for the purchase of relevant equipment. s. Kadra Mahamoud Hald, Chairman of DARYEL‘s orphanage and the First Lady of Djibouti, expressed gratitude to China Merchants Group for this project, and Ambassador Zhang Guoqing and Chairman of China Merchants Group Fu Yuning attended the donation ceremony. This project is completed.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China Merchants Group donates to Djibouti Child Protection Center and DARYEL orphanage

# Description
On March 21, 2013, the China Merchants Group held a ceremony for a donation to help support the Djibouti Child Protection Center and the orphanage of DARYEL in Djibouti. The donation is worth $200,000 USD and according to the China Merchants Group, this donation was made through China Merchants Charitable Foundation. China Merchants Group says that this donation was for the reconstruction and expansion of existing premises of the child protection center and the orphanage, as well as for the purchase of relevant equipment. s. Kadra Mahamoud Hald, Chairman of DARYEL‘s orphanage and the First Lady of Djibouti, expressed gratitude to China Merchants Group for this project, and Ambassador Zhang Guoqing and Chairman of China Merchants Group Fu Yuning attended the donation ceremony. This project is completed.
justification: Project focuses on social welfare and child protection without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation for reconstruction and expansion of child protection center and orphanage, purchase of relevant equipment

title: China provides grant financing for the School of Excellence Construction Project in Djibouti (Linked to #85281, ETCAs #66315, #59360, #30165)
description: Between 2012 and 2014, the Chinese government signed three different Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ETC) in order to finance the School of Excellence Construction Project (or Basic Education Project or l’École d’excellence or 援吉布提基础教育学校项目) in Djibouti. The first ETCA signed in February 2012 (#30165) provided a 40 million interest-free loan. The second ETCA signed in January 2013 (#66315) provided a grant of an unknown value. The third ETCA signed in January 2014 (#59360) granted $16.5 million USD. It is unclear how much of each ETCA was allocated towards the School of Excellence Project.   Hunan Today reported that the Chinese government contributed a total of 66 million RMB (about $10.7 million USD) to the School of Excellence Project. This project captures the grant funding derived from ETCAs #66315 and #59360. Project #85281 records the interest-free loan financing from ETCA #30165.   Hunan Province Architectural Design Institute Co., Ltd was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The School of Excellence is located in PK13 district of Djibouti City, about 12 km outside of the capital. Construction began on 16 June 2015 and ended on 15 December 2016. The school was opened and put into use on 10 September 2017. A formal project handover ceremony then took place on 17 September, 2017.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China provides grant financing for the School of Excellence Construction Project in Djibouti (Linked to #85281, ETCAs #66315, #59360, #30165)

# Description
Between 2012 and 2014, the Chinese government signed three different Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ETC) in order to finance the School of Excellence Construction Project (or Basic Education Project or l’École d’excellence or 援吉布提基础教育学校项目) in Djibouti. The first ETCA signed in February 2012 (#30165) provided a 40 million interest-free loan. The second ETCA signed in January 2013 (#66315) provided a grant of an unknown value. The third ETCA signed in January 2014 (#59360) granted $16.5 million USD. It is unclear how much of each ETCA was allocated towards the School of Excellence Project.   Hunan Today reported that the Chinese government contributed a total of 66 million RMB (about $10.7 million USD) to the School of Excellence Project. This project captures the grant funding derived from ETCAs #66315 and #59360. Project #85281 records the interest-free loan financing from ETCA #30165.   Hunan Province Architectural Design Institute Co., Ltd was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The School of Excellence is located in PK13 district of Djibouti City, about 12 km outside of the capital. Construction began on 16 June 2015 and ended on 15 December 2016. The school was opened and put into use on 10 September 2017. A formal project handover ceremony then took place on 17 September, 2017.
justification: Project focuses on education infrastructure development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: School construction project, education sector focus, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China Eximbank provides $15.4 million buyer’s credit loan for unspecified project with NORINCO in May 2013
description: On May 31, 2013, China Eximbank and the Government of Djibouti signed a $15,400,000 buyer's credit loan (BCL) agreement [No. BLA 201305]. The BCL carried the following borrowing terms: an 8-year maturity, a 1-year grace period, an interest rate of LIBOR plus a 3.2% margin, a 0.75% management fee, and a 0.75% commitment fee. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to finance 85% of the cost of a $19,279,290 commercial contract with NORINCO for an unspecified project. As of 2014, the loan had not yet disbursed.
staff_comments: 1. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate by adding 3.2% to average 6-month LIBOR in May 2013 (0.421%).2. The $15,400,000 buyer's credit loan that China Eximbank issued to the Government of Djibouti on May 31, 2013 is not included in the database of Chinese loan commitments that SAIS-CARI released in July 2020. Nor is it included it in the China’s Overseas Development Finance Dataset that Boston University's Global Development Policy Center published in December 2020.3. The purpose of this loan merits further investigation. NORINCO supported the implementation of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project as a contractor in Ethiopia. However, in 2018, NORINCO also provided technical assistance to support heavy equipment installation at the Chinese naval base in Djibouti. Another potentially relevant point is that the Armed Forces of Djibouti (FAD) are known to have acquired a WMA301 Assaulter Tank from NORINCO and a 66 meter landing ship with a 30 mm I/P17 remotely operated weapon station (ROWS) from NORINCO.4. NORINCO is a Chinese state-owned defense corporation that manufactures a diverse range of commercial and military products.
combined_text:
# Sector
UNALLOCATED/UNSPECIFIED

# Title
China Eximbank provides $15.4 million buyer’s credit loan for unspecified project with NORINCO in May 2013

# Description
On May 31, 2013, China Eximbank and the Government of Djibouti signed a $15,400,000 buyer's credit loan (BCL) agreement [No. BLA 201305]. The BCL carried the following borrowing terms: an 8-year maturity, a 1-year grace period, an interest rate of LIBOR plus a 3.2% margin, a 0.75% management fee, and a 0.75% commitment fee. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to finance 85% of the cost of a $19,279,290 commercial contract with NORINCO for an unspecified project. As of 2014, the loan had not yet disbursed.
justification: Project purpose is unspecified and involves a financial services transaction
evidence: Buyer's credit loan agreement with unspecified project details, financial terms provided but no project specifics

title: Chinese Embassy donates 5 boxes of Chinese language learning materials to Orion Academy
description: On December 6, 2013, the Chinese Embassy in Dominica donated 5 boxes of Chinese language learning materials to the Orion Academy to assist the school's new Chinese language course. The donated materials included textbooks, exercise books, charts, and other materials. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

The donated materials included textbooks, exercise books, charts, and other materials. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

title: China provides office supplies and laptops to Dominican assembly
description: On January 24, 2013 30 desktop computers, 6 laptop computers, 6 black and white laser printers, 30 sets of computer desks and 30 office chairs were handed over in an official ceremony in accordance with token gifts that were promised to the Government of Dominica by a delegation from the People's Republic of China.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China provides office supplies and laptops to Dominican assembly

# Description
On January 24, 2013 30 desktop computers, 6 laptop computers, 6 black and white laser printers, 30 sets of computer desks and 30 office chairs were handed over in an official ceremony in accordance with token gifts that were promised to the Government of Dominica by a delegation from the People's Republic of China.
justification: Project involves provision of office equipment with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Delivery of computers, printers, and office furniture to government assembly

title: China financed the Renovation of Newtown Primary School in Dominica (Linked to Project #39846)
description: On October 9, 2013, the construction contract of the new New Town Primary School was signed between China Construction International Ltd. and the Dominican Ministry of Education. Chinese Ambassador Wang Zonglai, Dominican Prime Minister Roosevelt Skerrit and some cabinet ministers attended the ceremony.  A media article covered the signing ceremony for a $6 million grant from China for the construction of the school but the currency is not clear. It is a Dominican source so it is presumed to be EC.    The construction is to include 14 classrooms, labs, an auditorium, an elevator as well as improvements to the road way, parking lot and a hard court.  The New Town Primary School was officially opened on September 26, 2016. According to Dominca's Report of the Director of Audit on the Audit of the Accounts for the Fiscal Year ended June 30, 2015, the project used up 3,156,075 EC in grants and capital revenue.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China financed the Renovation of Newtown Primary School in Dominica (Linked to Project #39846)

# Description
On October 9, 2013, the construction contract of the new New Town Primary School was signed between China Construction International Ltd. and the Dominican Ministry of Education. Chinese Ambassador Wang Zonglai, Dominican Prime Minister Roosevelt Skerrit and some cabinet ministers attended the ceremony.  A media article covered the signing ceremony for a $6 million grant from China for the construction of the school but the currency is not clear. It is a Dominican source so it is presumed to be EC.    The construction is to include 14 classrooms, labs, an auditorium, an elevator as well as improvements to the road way, parking lot and a hard court.  The New Town Primary School was officially opened on September 26, 2016. According to Dominca's Report of the Director of Audit on the Audit of the Accounts for the Fiscal Year ended June 30, 2015, the project used up 3,156,075 EC in grants and capital revenue.
justification: Project is focused on educational infrastructure development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of primary school with classrooms, labs, and auditorium; education sector focus

title: China Grants XCD $9M in 2,500 LED Solar Powered Street Lights to Dominica
description: In July 2013, China's National Development and Reform Commission and the Dominican Ministry of Public Works, Energy and Ports signed the Memorandum of Understanding Concerning the Provision of Goods for Addressing Climate Change and donated 2,500 LED solar powered street lamps to Dominica, to be installed under the Canefield cliff on the Dr. Nicholas Liverpool and the Edward Oliver Le Blanc highways. The project was valued at approximately $9.0 million and made driving at night safer and more comfortable.   The lights were reported to arrive in Roseau "in a few months," as of September 2013. According to Dominica's Budget Address for FY 2015/2016, the donation has been completed. The project was expected to be implemented over a three year period.   This was part of a larger project to install 4,851 solar lights, which had an overall cost of 34 million USD and would be implemented in multiple phases. It appears the first phase involved the installation of the 2,500 lights granted by the Chinese government.
staff_comments: Transaction amount assumed to be XCD, not USD, because it is taken from the Government of Dominica's Budget Address.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Grants XCD $9M in 2,500 LED Solar Powered Street Lights to Dominica

# Description
In July 2013, China's National Development and Reform Commission and the Dominican Ministry of Public Works, Energy and Ports signed the Memorandum of Understanding Concerning the Provision of Goods for Addressing Climate Change and donated 2,500 LED solar powered street lamps to Dominica, to be installed under the Canefield cliff on the Dr. Nicholas Liverpool and the Edward Oliver Le Blanc highways. The project was valued at approximately $9.0 million and made driving at night safer and more comfortable.   The lights were reported to arrive in Roseau "in a few months," as of September 2013. According to Dominica's Budget Address for FY 2015/2016, the donation has been completed. The project was expected to be implemented over a three year period.   This was part of a larger project to install 4,851 solar lights, which had an overall cost of 34 million USD and would be implemented in multiple phases. It appears the first phase involved the installation of the 2,500 lights granted by the Chinese government.
justification: Primary purpose is solar-powered LED street lighting, directly supporting renewable energy use
evidence: 2,500 LED solar powered street lamps, part of climate change mitigation initiative

title: China sends ophthalmologists to Dominica
description: In December, 2013, Chinese National Health and Family Planning Commission and Dominican Ministry of Health signed a memorandum of understanding on sending Chinese ophthalmologists to Dominica on the Brightness Action Program to provide free medical consultancy and surgery services to cataract patients.

# Title

justification: Project focuses on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Ophthalmologists providing free medical consultancy and surgery services to cataract patients

title: China Grants Police Equipment to the  Commonwealth of Dominica Police Force
description: On November 28, 2013, the Commonwealth of Dominica Police Force (CPDF) received 90 patrol motorcycles, 250 police safety sunglasses and other crime fighting accessories from the People's Republic of China. The equipment will be used to assist in Dominica's continued efforts to curb crime on the Island. It is mentioned by the official website of the Government of the Commonwealth of Dominica that the Dominica Police Force has also been taught formal communication language skills in Chinese Mandarin.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China Grants Police Equipment to the  Commonwealth of Dominica Police Force

# Description
On November 28, 2013, the Commonwealth of Dominica Police Force (CPDF) received 90 patrol motorcycles, 250 police safety sunglasses and other crime fighting accessories from the People's Republic of China. The equipment will be used to assist in Dominica's continued efforts to curb crime on the Island. It is mentioned by the official website of the Government of the Commonwealth of Dominica that the Dominica Police Force has also been taught formal communication language skills in Chinese Mandarin.
justification: Project involves provision of police equipment and training, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Patrol motorcycles, police safety sunglasses, crime fighting accessories, language training
